title: Collage, "Design for Textile", 1957–59
medium: Colored paper, colored pencil, graphite on off-white tracing paper
inscribed: In black colored pencil, upper left: "47 1/2" [arrow]; in red colored pencil, right center: "NOT MADE"
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Design is in two sections, upper and lower. Upper section consists of a pattern of orange and pink cut paper ovals with alternating linear teardrops in magenta and green colored pencil. The pattern is sectioned into vertical columns by double black lines.  The lower section of the pattern is identical to the upper section, without the black sectional lines.

tombstone.epitaph: Collage, "Design for Textile", 1957–59.Colored paper, colored pencil, graphite on off-white tracing paper. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-285.
